column4: aparently i need yacc to compile something, can anyone tell me which package provides that ?
do a search in synaptic for yacc and see what comes up
quite some stuff
sounds like you have some reading to do
yes but it won'T be mounted unless you add it to fstab
thats what i wanted to know
when i installed ubuntu fstab was autogenerated, how do i have it update
you need to edit it manualy,   gksu  gedit /etc/fstab
there must be a gui way to do it
just copy one of the other lines,  and make appropriate modifications
nope that 's how you do it
try windows then
technicaly, this is gui,   cli is something else
do i need to create a folder in /media ?
there or eslewhere,  but yes,  you need to create a mount point    sudo mkdir /path/of/your/choice     ,  in /mnt or in /media ,   /media will dislpay the folder on your desktop
i just resized a partition and even tho it mounts correctly to /media it doesn#t appear on the desktop anymore
you will need to restart X
and you donT' mount to /media,  you mount to a dir inside /media like  /media/folder
ya, i didn't specify a dir at all actually
if you donT' specify a dir it won't get mounted at all
it does, to default mount location in /media
